vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.1: It is used to expose machine input and output ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.2: Let's say it's attached to a speed controller
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.3: You can now set speed and get speed from proxy ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.7: For resistor, you can get and set RATIO in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.8: For propeller, you can get and set SPEED in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.9: For cannons, you can get PITCH and YAW in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.10: For tweaked lectern controller, you can get player INPUT AXIS in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.11: Just try it yourself to see what you can get/set!
